results.title: Hawaii: the 50th state
results.brief_description: Describes the birth of the Hawaiian Islands and the creation of their spectacular land forms. Shows views of the still-active volcanoes on the island of Hawaii and the silent craters of Maui. Includes scenes of the city of Honolulu and of sugar and pineapple plantations.
results.description: Describes the birth of the Hawaiian Islands and the creation of their spectacular land forms. Shows views of the still-active volcanoes on the island of Hawaii and the silent craters of Maui. Includes scenes of the city of Honolulu and of sugar and pineapple plantations.

results.title: Hawaii calls
results.creator_credit: T.W. Cate and Cate and McGlone Films
results.brief_description: Provides a good historical background and shows the great variety of scenery, fine hotels and Polynesian hospitality, together with the spirit of “Aloha” which make the Hawaiian Islands an ideal place for a holiday. Includes the many activities available to the tourists on the different islands - sports, night life, or just lazing in the sun.

results.title: Having twins
results.brief_description: Focuses on the experiences of several couples who have experienced the joys and problems associated with having twins. Includes comments by an obstetrician who explains the reasons why complications often attend the birth of twins, as well as footage showing an actual multiple birth.
results.description: Focuses on the experiences of several couples who have experienced the joys and problems associated with having twins. results.title: Having a say: Helene
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Helen came to Australia from France and found difficulty in fitting in. Language was a basic factor in her problem, but through English in the Workplace, her life changed as did her work satisfaction level.

results.title: Having a say
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: The English in the Workplace Scheme is designed to help non-English speaking unionists to take their place in Australian society. This program outlines the problems and the responses to the scheme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group

results.title: Haven of peace
results.creator_credit: Department of Social Development (Dar-es-Salaam) and African Film Productions
results.brief_description: Considers the place of Dar-es-Salam in the development of a large multi-racial community. The port is represented as a colorful mixture of the old and the new, its traditional life and culture existing side by side with modern health, education and social services, housing schemes, and improvements in trade and communications.

results.title: Have You Ever Thought?
results.creator_credit: Doreen Bentley and Christian Myles Productions
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives and the work of the Pastorelle Sisters, an order of Nuns in Thornbury, Melbourne. Their lives are centred around the person and teaching of Jesus, lived out in small communities, deeply concerned about the life of people, and working with clergy and laity in the building up of Christian communities.

results.title: Have our planet and eat it too
results.brief_description: Shows controversy between a company in favour of open-pit mining on national forest land, and a community that opposes this land usage. Deals with the concern over changes in water, air, wildlife and vegetation, and the conflict between old mining laws, and the National Environmental Policy Act.

results.title: Have I told you lately that I love you? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A symbolic record of one day in the life of the members of an upper-middle-class American family, showing their dependence upon machines and the effect of automation on their relationships with one another.

results.title: Have I ever lied to you before?
results.creator_credit: John Spotton, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Advertising and Jerry Goodis are an inseparable combination. This fascinating documentary takes a behind-the-scenes looks at the power plays in the advertising business in Canada. It explores the conflict and the difficulties faced on the production of one particular commercial which Goodis does not like, yet has to sell. Includes a ‘Hush Puppies’ commercial showing people talking to their feet. Photographed by Douglas Kiefer.
